Convert a nested tibble into a node tree

Source: R/nested-to-tree.R
create_node_from_nested_root.Rd

This function is convenient to display all nesting levels of a nested tibble at once.

create_node_from_nested_root(pd_nested, structure_only)

Arguments

pd_nested

A nested tibble.
structure_only

Whether or not create a tree that represents the structure of the expression without any information on the tokens. Useful to check whether two structures are identical.

Value

An object of class "Node" and "R6".

Examples

if (rlang::is_installed("data.tree")) {
  code <- "a <- function(x) { if(x > 1) { 1+1 } else {x} }"
  nested_pd <- styler:::compute_parse_data_nested(code)
  initialized <- styler:::pre_visit(nested_pd, c(default_style_guide_attributes))
  styler:::create_node_from_nested_root(initialized, structure_only = FALSE)
}
#>                                                  levelName
#> 1  ROOT (token: short_text [lag_newlines/spaces] {pos_id})
#> 2   °--expr:  [0/0] {1}                                   
#> 3       ¦--expr:  [0/1] {3}                               
#> 4       ¦   °--SYMBOL: a [0/0] {2}                        
#> 5       ¦--LEFT_ASSIGN: <- [0/1] {4}                      
#> 6       °--expr:  [0/0] {5}                               
#> 7           ¦--FUNCTION: funct [0/0] {6}                  
#> 8           ¦--'(': ( [0/0] {7}                           
#> 9           ¦--SYMBOL_FORMALS: x [0/0] {8}                
#> 10          ¦--')': ) [0/1] {9}                           
#> 11          °--expr:  [0/0] {10}                          
#> 12              ¦--'{': { [0/1] {11}                      
#> 13              ¦--expr:  [0/1] {12}                      
#> 14              ¦   ¦--IF: if [0/0] {13}                  
#> 15              ¦   ¦--'(': ( [0/0] {14}                  
#> 16              ¦   ¦--expr:  [0/0] {15}                  
#> 17              ¦   ¦   ¦--expr:  [0/1] {17}              
#> 18              ¦   ¦   ¦   °--SYMBOL: x [0/0] {16}       
#> 19              ¦   ¦   ¦--GT: > [0/1] {18}               
#> 20              ¦   ¦   °--expr:  [0/0] {20}              
#> 21              ¦   ¦       °--NUM_CONST: 1 [0/0] {19}    
#> 22              ¦   ¦--')': ) [0/1] {21}                  
#> 23              ¦   ¦--expr:  [0/1] {22}                  
#> 24              ¦   ¦   ¦--'{': { [0/1] {23}              
#> 25              ¦   ¦   ¦--expr:  [0/1] {24}              
#> 26              ¦   ¦   ¦   ¦--expr:  [0/0] {26}          
#> 27              ¦   ¦   ¦   ¦   °--NUM_CONST: 1 [0/0] {25}
#> 28              ¦   ¦   ¦   ¦--'+': + [0/0] {27}          
#> 29              ¦   ¦   ¦   °--expr:  [0/0] {29}          
#> 30              ¦   ¦   ¦       °--NUM_CONST: 1 [0/0] {28}
#> 31              ¦   ¦   °--'}': } [0/0] {30}              
#> 32              ¦   ¦--ELSE: else [0/1] {31}              
#> 33              ¦   °--expr:  [0/0] {32}                  
#> 34              ¦       ¦--'{': { [0/0] {33}              
#> 35              ¦       ¦--expr:  [0/0] {35}              
#> 36              ¦       ¦   °--SYMBOL: x [0/0] {34}       
#> 37              ¦       °--'}': } [0/0] {36}              
#> 38              °--'}': } [0/0] {37}
